_header: John Clerk of Torrington I dare avow
Subjects: carols, satirical; Clerk, John, of Torrington (Devon)
_description: Against John Clerke of Torrington, an English flyting — six cross-rhymed quatrains and a single six-line stanza, with burden: ‘Synge and blow, blow wel blow / Synge wen so Y blow’

Stanbr3.First Lines:
Ion Clerke of toryton I dar wel awowHe ys my lordys kynneFor
                    he hath ikepte þe gryte sowWith alle my lady swyne…
Stanbr3.Last Lines:
…No man may hym benyme ne lettThe messe of þe sow
                    tayle
Stanbr3.Editions:
Ker,  Neil Ripley. 
             “Middle English Verses and a Latin Letter in a Manuscript at Stanbrook
